004
005package edu.wpi.first.epilogue;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.epilogue.logging.DataLogger;
008import edu.wpi.first.epilogue.logging.NTDataLogger;
009import edu.wpi.first.epilogue.logging.errors.ErrorHandler;
010import edu.wpi.first.epilogue.logging.errors.ErrorPrinter;
011import edu.wpi.first.networktables.NetworkTableInstance;
012import edu.wpi.first.units.Measure;
013import edu.wpi.first.units.Time;
014
015/**
016 * A configuration object to be used by the generated {@code Epilogue} class to customize its
017 * behavior.
018 */
019@SuppressWarnings("checkstyle:MemberName")
020public class EpilogueConfiguration {
021  /**
022   * The data logger implementation for Epilogue to use. By default, this will log data directly to
023   * NetworkTables. NetworkTable data can be mirrored to a log file on disk by calling {@code
024   * DataLogManager.start()} in your {@code robotInit} method.
025   */
026  public DataLogger dataLogger = new NTDataLogger(NetworkTableInstance.getDefault());
027
028  /**
029   * The period Epilogue will log at. By default this is the period that the robot runs at. This is
030   * the field used by bind to configure speed when adding the periodic logging function
031   */
032  public Measure<Time> loggingPeriod;
033
034  /**
035   * The offset from the periodic run that Epilogue will log at. By default this will be half of the
036   * robots period. This is the field used by bind when adding the periodic logging function
037   */
038  public Measure<Time> loggingPeriodOffset;
039
040  /**
041   * The minimum importance level of data to be logged. Defaults to debug, which logs data of all
042   * importance levels. Any data tagged with an importance level lower than this will not be logged.
043   */
044  public Logged.Importance minimumImportance = Logged.Importance.DEBUG;
045
046  /**
047   * The error handler for loggers to use if they encounter an error while logging. Defaults to
048   * printing an error to the standard output.
049   */
050  public ErrorHandler errorHandler = new ErrorPrinter();
051
052  /**
053   * The root identifier to use for all logged data. Defaults to "Robot", but can be changed to any
054   * string.
055   */
056  public String root = "Robot";
057
058  /** Default constructor. */
059  public EpilogueConfiguration() {}
060}
